So said  Jonathan Gossage  on  2002-10-25 

>----- Original Message -----
>From: "Robert Watkins" <robertdw@...>
>To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
>Sent: Thursday, October 24, 2002 5:23 PM
>Subject: Re: [junit] Junit test
>
>
>> On Thu, 2002-10-24 at 13:49, Sanjay Mantoor wrote:
>> > Please help me for the following issues.
>> > How  data driven test cases can be done in JUnit without much
change
>> > in test script?
>>
>> Put all the test data in an external file. I like XML for this
because
>> it gives me an easy grouping in the file.
>>
>> In the test's suite() method, read in the file. For each grouping,
>> create a TestCase instance, add the data from the grouping to it,
and
>> then stick it in the suite().
>
>I have used this technique quite successfully but there is one naging
>problem that I have not solved. Typically with data driven testing you
have
>one test method (or possibly a small set of methods) and each method
runs
>many tests. The Junit TestCase class uses the method name as the test
name
>and I would really like to have a unique name for each test (which is
easy
>to provide in the test data.) Has anyone any ideas on how to address
this
>issue?

In JUnit 3.8.x, I believe Test.setName() is a public method now. Could
you use that somehow?

J. B. Rainsberger,
